entry.title: STC model
entry.content:
Table of Contents

  • Table of Contents
  • Generalities
  • Coordinate Frames
    • DSL
    • VOTable
  • Positions
    • ICRS position
      • DSL
      • VOTable
    • FK4 B1950 position
      • DSL
      • VOTable
    • ICRS Position with Ellipse Error
      • DSL
      • VOTable
    • ICRS Position with Symmetric Error
      • DSL
      • VOTable
  • Time measurements
    • TT ISO Time
      • DSL
      • VOTable
    • TT JD Time
      • DSL
      • VOTable
    • TT MJD Time
      • DSL
      • VOTable
  • Custom Frames
    • TT MET Time
      • DSL
      • VOTable
  • Other Measurements
    • Magnitude with Symmetric Error
      • DSL
      • VOTable
    • Magnitude with Asymmetric Error
      • DSL
      • VOTable
  • Notes
    • Quantities
    • Time type casting
    • Coordinate frames, positions, and axes.
    • Other (minor) stuff
    • VODML Mapping

Generalities

As for the other examples we provide two representations for the instances. One is expressed in a Domain Specific Language (DSL) that we are developing along with the VODML-related standards.

The DSL is independent of the serialization format, and allows to describe the instances in a simpler language without much boilerplate.

We also provide the VOTable serializations of those instances, which is what providers and clients will need to work with in practice.

Coordinate Frames

A coordinate frame defines:

  • its origin in terms of another reference frame, possibly a standard one
  • its orientation or direction
  • the coordinate axes it is composed of.

Note that a library of common/standard reference frames can be built in a single VOTable. Intances in other files can refer to such frames when declaring their positions. The following example represents such a library of frames.

DSL

File: /examples/stc2/current/instances/standard-frames.jovial 

def modelsFolder = "file:../models"
def voluteFolder = "https://volute.g-vo.org/svn/trunk/projects/dm/vo-dml/models/"

def coordsLocation = new URL("$modelsFolder/STC_coords-v2.0.vo-dml.xml")
def ivoaLocation = new URL("$voluteFolder/ivoa/vo-dml/IVOA-v1.0.vo-dml.xml")


dmInstance {
    model(vodmlURL: coordsLocation)
    model(vodmlURL: ivoaLocation)

    instance(id: "FK4_B1950_FRAME", type: "stc2_coordinates:domain.space.SpaceFrame") {
        instance role: "spaceRefFrame", value: "FK4"
        instance(role: "equinox") {
            instance role: "type", value: "B"
            instance role: "year", value: "1950.0"
        }
        instance(role: "coordSpace", type: "stc2_coordinates:domain.space.Spherical") {
            instance(role: "coordAxis", id: "FK4_B1950_RA_AXIS") {
                instance role: "name", value: "ra"
                instance role: "domainMin", value: 0.0, unit: "deg", type: "ivoa:RealQuantity"
                instance role: "domainMax", value: 360.0, unit: "deg", type: "ivoa:RealQuantity"
            }
            instance(role: "coordAxis", id: "FK4_B1950_DEC_AXIS") {
                instance role: "name", value: "dec"
                instance role: "domainMin", value: -90.0, unit: "deg", type: "ivoa:RealQuantity"
                instance role: "domainMax", value: 90.0, unit: "deg", type: "ivoa:RealQuantity"
            }
        }
    }

    instance(id: "FK4_J2000_FRAME", type: "stc2_coordinates:domain.space.SpaceFrame") {
        instance role: "spaceRefFrame", value: "FK4"
        instance(role: "equinox") {
            instance role: "type", value: "J"
            instance role: "year", value: "2000.0"
        }
        instance(role: "coordSpace", type: "stc2_coordinates:domain.space.Spherical") {
            instance(role: "coordAxis", id: "FK4_J2000_RA_AXIS") {
                instance role: "name", value: "ra"
                instance role: "domainMin", value: 0.0, unit: "deg", type: "ivoa:RealQuantity"
                instance role: "domainMax", value: 360.0, unit: "deg", type: "ivoa:RealQuantity"
            }
            instance(role: "coordAxis", id: "FK4_J2000_DEC_AXIS") {
                instance role: "name", value: "dec"
                instance role: "domainMin", value: -90.0, unit: "deg", type: "ivoa:RealQuantity"
                instance role: "domainMax", value: 90.0, unit: "deg", type: "ivoa:RealQuantity"
            }
        }
    }

    instance(id: "ICRS_FRAME", type: "stc2_coordinates:domain.space.SpaceFrame") {
        instance role: "spaceRefFrame", value: "ICRS"

        instance(role: "coordSpace", type: "stc2_coordinates:domain.space.Spherical") {
            instance(role: "coordAxis", id: "ICRS_RA_AXIS") {
                instance role: "name", value: "ra"
                instance role: "domainMin", value: 0.0, unit: "deg", type: "ivoa:RealQuantity"
                instance role: "domainMax", value: 360.0, unit: "deg", type: "ivoa:RealQuantity"
            }
            instance(role: "coordAxis", id: "ICRS_DEC_AXIS") {
                instance role: "name", value: "dec"
                instance role: "domainMin", value: -90.0, unit: "deg", type: "ivoa:RealQuantity"
                instance role: "domainMax", value: 90.0, unit: "deg", type: "ivoa:RealQuantity"
            }
        }
    }

    instance(id: "TT_FRAME", type: "stc2_coordinates:domain.time.TimeFrame") {
        instance role: "timeScale", value: "TT"

        instance(role: "coordSpace", type: "stc2_coordinates:domain.time.TimeSpace") {
            instance(role: "coordAxis", id: "TT_AXIS") {
                instance role: "name", value: "time"
                instance role: "domainMin", value: 0, type: "ivoa:RealQuantity"
                instance role: "domainMax", value: "+Inf", type: "ivoa:RealQuantity"
            }
        }
    }

    instance(id: "JD_FRAME", type: "stc2_coordinates:domain.time.TimeFrame") {
        instance role: "timeScale", value: "TT"

        instance(role: "coordSpace", type: "stc2_coordinates:domain.time.TimeSpace") {
            instance(role: "coordAxis", id: "JD_TT_AXIS") {
                instance role: "name", value: "jd"
                instance role: "domainMin", value: 0, type: "ivoa:RealQuantity"
                instance role: "domainMax", value: "+Inf", type: "ivoa:RealQuantity"
            }
        }
    }

    instance(id: "MJD_FRAME", type: "stc2_coordinates:domain.time.TimeFrame") {
        instance role: "timeScale", value: "TT"
        instance(role: "timeOrigin", type: "stc2_coordinates:domain.time.TimeOffset") {
            instance role: "cval", value: 2400000.5
            reference(role: "coordAxis") {
                idref("JD_TT_AXIS")
            }
        }

        instance(role: "coordSpace", type: "stc2_coordinates:domain.time.TimeSpace") {
            instance(role: "coordAxis", id: "MJD_TT_AXIS") {
                instance role: "name", value: "mjd"
                instance role: "domainMin", value: 0, type: "ivoa:RealQuantity"
                instance role: "domainMax", value: "+Inf", type: "ivoa:RealQuantity"
            }
        }
    }
}

VOTable

File: /examples/stc2/current/instances/standard-frames.vot.xml 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><VOTABLE xmlns="http://www.ivoa.net/xml/VOTable/v1.4" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <VODML>
    <MODEL>
      <NAME>stc2_coordinates</NAME>
      <URL>file:../models/STC_coords-v2.0.vo-dml.xml</URL>
    </MODEL>
    <MODEL>
      <NAME>ivoa</NAME>
      <URL>https://volute.g-vo.org/svn/trunk/projects/dm/vo-dml/models//ivoa/vo-dml/IVOA-v1.0.vo-dml.xml</URL>
    </MODEL>
    <GLOBALS>
      <INSTANCE dmtype="stc2_coordinates:domain.space.SpaceFrame" ID="FK4_B1950_FRAME">
        <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:domain.space.SpaceFrame.spaceRefFrame">
          <LITERAL value="FK4" dmtype="stc2_coordinates:domain.space.StdRefFrame"/>
        </ATTRIBUTE>
        <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:domain.space.SpaceFrame.equinox">
          <INSTANCE dmtype="stc2_coordinates:domain.space.Epoch">
            <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:domain.space.Epoch.type">
              <LITERAL value="B" dmtype="stc2_coordinates:domain.space.EpochType"/>
            </ATTRIBUTE>
            <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:domain.space.Epoch.year">
              <LITERAL value="1950.0" dmtype="ivoa:real"/>
            </ATTRIBUTE>
          </INSTANCE>
        </ATTRIBUTE>
        <COMPOSITION dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordFrame.coordSpace">
          <INSTANCE dmtype="stc2_coordinates:domain.space.Spherical">
            <COMPOSITION dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordSpace.coordAxis">
              <INSTANCE dmtype="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordAxis" ID="FK4_B1950_RA_AXIS">
                <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.Axis.name">
                  <LITERAL value="ra" dmtype="ivoa:string"/>
                </ATTRIBUTE>
                <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordAxis.domainMin">
                  <LITERAL value="0.0" dmtype="ivoa:RealQuantity" unit="deg"/>
                </ATTRIBUTE>
                <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordAxis.domainMax">
                  <LITERAL value="360.0" dmtype="ivoa:RealQuantity" unit="deg"/>
                </ATTRIBUTE>
              </INSTANCE>
              <INSTANCE dmtype="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordAxis" ID="FK4_B1950_DEC_AXIS">
                <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.Axis.name">
                  <LITERAL value="dec" dmtype="ivoa:string"/>
                </ATTRIBUTE>
                <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordAxis.domainMin">
                  <LITERAL value="-90.0" dmtype="ivoa:RealQuantity" unit="deg"/>
                </ATTRIBUTE>
                <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordAxis.domainMax">
                  <LITERAL value="90.0" dmtype="ivoa:RealQuantity" unit="deg"/>
                </ATTRIBUTE>
              </INSTANCE>
            </COMPOSITION>
          </INSTANCE>
        </COMPOSITION>
      </INSTANCE>
      <INSTANCE dmtype="stc2_coordinates:domain.space.SpaceFrame" ID="FK4_J2000_FRAME">
        <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:domain.space.SpaceFrame.spaceRefFrame">
          <LITERAL value="FK4" dmtype="stc2_coordinates:domain.space.StdRefFrame"/>
        </ATTRIBUTE>
        <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:domain.space.SpaceFrame.equinox">
          <INSTANCE dmtype="stc2_coordinates:domain.space.Epoch">
            <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:domain.space.Epoch.type">
              <LITERAL value="J" dmtype="stc2_coordinates:domain.space.EpochType"/>
            </ATTRIBUTE>
            <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:domain.space.Epoch.year">
              <LITERAL value="2000.0" dmtype="ivoa:real"/>
            </ATTRIBUTE>
          </INSTANCE>
        </ATTRIBUTE>
        <COMPOSITION dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordFrame.coordSpace">
          <INSTANCE dmtype="stc2_coordinates:domain.space.Spherical">
            <COMPOSITION dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordSpace.coordAxis">
              <INSTANCE dmtype="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordAxis" ID="FK4_J2000_RA_AXIS">
                <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.Axis.name">
                  <LITERAL value="ra" dmtype="ivoa:string"/>
                </ATTRIBUTE>
                <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordAxis.domainMin">
                  <LITERAL value="0.0" dmtype="ivoa:RealQuantity" unit="deg"/>
                </ATTRIBUTE>
                <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordAxis.domainMax">
                  <LITERAL value="360.0" dmtype="ivoa:RealQuantity" unit="deg"/>
                </ATTRIBUTE>
              </INSTANCE>
              <INSTANCE dmtype="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordAxis" ID="FK4_J2000_DEC_AXIS">
                <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.Axis.name">
                  <LITERAL value="dec" dmtype="ivoa:string"/>
                </ATTRIBUTE>
                <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordAxis.domainMin">
                  <LITERAL value="-90.0" dmtype="ivoa:RealQuantity" unit="deg"/>
                </ATTRIBUTE>
                <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordAxis.domainMax">
                  <LITERAL value="90.0" dmtype="ivoa:RealQuantity" unit="deg"/>
                </ATTRIBUTE>
              </INSTANCE>
            </COMPOSITION>
          </INSTANCE>
        </COMPOSITION>
      </INSTANCE>
      <INSTANCE dmtype="stc2_coordinates:domain.space.SpaceFrame" ID="ICRS_FRAME">
        <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:domain.space.SpaceFrame.spaceRefFrame">
          <LITERAL value="ICRS" dmtype="stc2_coordinates:domain.space.StdRefFrame"/>
        </ATTRIBUTE>
        <COMPOSITION dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordFrame.coordSpace">
          <INSTANCE dmtype="stc2_coordinates:domain.space.Spherical">
            <COMPOSITION dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordSpace.coordAxis">
              <INSTANCE dmtype="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordAxis" ID="ICRS_RA_AXIS">
                <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.Axis.name">
                  <LITERAL value="ra" dmtype="ivoa:string"/>
                </ATTRIBUTE>
                <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordAxis.domainMin">
                  <LITERAL value="0.0" dmtype="ivoa:RealQuantity" unit="deg"/>
                </ATTRIBUTE>
                <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordAxis.domainMax">
                  <LITERAL value="360.0" dmtype="ivoa:RealQuantity" unit="deg"/>
                </ATTRIBUTE>
              </INSTANCE>
              <INSTANCE dmtype="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordAxis" ID="ICRS_DEC_AXIS">
                <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.Axis.name">
                  <LITERAL value="dec" dmtype="ivoa:string"/>
                </ATTRIBUTE>
                <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordAxis.domainMin">
                  <LITERAL value="-90.0" dmtype="ivoa:RealQuantity" unit="deg"/>
                </ATTRIBUTE>
                <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordAxis.domainMax">
                  <LITERAL value="90.0" dmtype="ivoa:RealQuantity" unit="deg"/>
                </ATTRIBUTE>
              </INSTANCE>
            </COMPOSITION>
          </INSTANCE>
        </COMPOSITION>
      </INSTANCE>
      <INSTANCE dmtype="stc2_coordinates:domain.time.TimeFrame" ID="TT_FRAME">
        <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:domain.time.TimeFrame.timeScale">
          <LITERAL value="TT" dmtype="stc2_coordinates:domain.time.TimeScale"/>
        </ATTRIBUTE>
        <COMPOSITION dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordFrame.coordSpace">
          <INSTANCE dmtype="stc2_coordinates:domain.time.TimeSpace">
            <COMPOSITION dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordSpace.coordAxis">
              <INSTANCE dmtype="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordAxis" ID="TT_AXIS">
                <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.Axis.name">
                  <LITERAL value="time" dmtype="ivoa:string"/>
                </ATTRIBUTE>
                <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordAxis.domainMin">
                  <LITERAL value="0" dmtype="ivoa:RealQuantity"/>
                </ATTRIBUTE>
                <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordAxis.domainMax">
                  <LITERAL value="+Inf" dmtype="ivoa:RealQuantity"/>
                </ATTRIBUTE>
              </INSTANCE>
            </COMPOSITION>
          </INSTANCE>
        </COMPOSITION>
      </INSTANCE>
      <INSTANCE dmtype="stc2_coordinates:domain.time.TimeFrame" ID="JD_FRAME">
        <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:domain.time.TimeFrame.timeScale">
          <LITERAL value="TT" dmtype="stc2_coordinates:domain.time.TimeScale"/>
        </ATTRIBUTE>
        <COMPOSITION dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordFrame.coordSpace">
          <INSTANCE dmtype="stc2_coordinates:domain.time.TimeSpace">
            <COMPOSITION dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordSpace.coordAxis">
              <INSTANCE dmtype="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordAxis" ID="JD_TT_AXIS">
                <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.Axis.name">
                  <LITERAL value="jd" dmtype="ivoa:string"/>
                </ATTRIBUTE>
                <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordAxis.domainMin">
                  <LITERAL value="0" dmtype="ivoa:RealQuantity"/>
                </ATTRIBUTE>
                <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordAxis.domainMax">
                  <LITERAL value="+Inf" dmtype="ivoa:RealQuantity"/>
                </ATTRIBUTE>
              </INSTANCE>
            </COMPOSITION>
          </INSTANCE>
        </COMPOSITION>
      </INSTANCE>
      <INSTANCE dmtype="stc2_coordinates:domain.time.TimeFrame" ID="MJD_FRAME">
        <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:domain.time.TimeFrame.timeScale">
          <LITERAL value="TT" dmtype="stc2_coordinates:domain.time.TimeScale"/>
        </ATTRIBUTE>
        <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:domain.time.TimeFrame.timeOrigin">
          <INSTANCE dmtype="stc2_coordinates:domain.time.TimeOffset">
            <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coords.PhysicalCoordValue.cval">
              <LITERAL value="2400000.5" dmtype="ivoa:RealQuantity"/>
            </ATTRIBUTE>
            <REFERENCE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coords.CoordValue.coordAxis">
              <IDREF>JD_TT_AXIS</IDREF>
            </REFERENCE>
          </INSTANCE>
        </ATTRIBUTE>
        <COMPOSITION dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordFrame.coordSpace">
          <INSTANCE dmtype="stc2_coordinates:domain.time.TimeSpace">
            <COMPOSITION dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordSpace.coordAxis">
              <INSTANCE dmtype="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordAxis" ID="MJD_TT_AXIS">
                <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.Axis.name">
                  <LITERAL value="mjd" dmtype="ivoa:string"/>
                </ATTRIBUTE>
                <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordAxis.domainMin">
                  <LITERAL value="0" dmtype="ivoa:RealQuantity"/>
                </ATTRIBUTE>
                <ATTRIBUTE dmrole="stc2_coordinates:coordsystem.CoordAxis.domainMax">
                  <LITERAL value="+Inf" dmtype="ivoa:RealQuantity"/>
                </ATTRIBUTE>
              </INSTANCE>
            </COMPOSITION>
          </INSTANCE>
        </COMPOSITION>
      </INSTANCE>
    </GLOBALS>
  </VODML>
</VOTABLE>

Positions

Positions can be expressed in terms of the coordinate axes defined as part of the coordinate frames, even remotely as shown in the examples below, where positions refer to axes defined in the standard-frames.vot.xml file.

Below are two examples of the same 2D position in the sky in two different reference frames.

ICRS position

DSL

File: /examples/stc2/current/instances/position-icrs.jovial 

def modelsFolder = "file:../models"
def voluteFolder = "https://volute.g-vo.org/svn/trunk/projects/dm/vo-dml/models/"

def coordsLocation = new URL("$modelsFolder/STC_coords-v2.0.vo-dml.xml")
def measLocation = new URL("$modelsFolder/STC_meas-v2.0.vo-dml.xml")
def ivoaLocation = new URL("$voluteFolder/ivoa/vo-dml/IVOA-v1.0.vo-dml.xml")

dmInstance {
    model(vodmlURL: coordsLocation)
    model(vodmlURL: measLocation)
    model(vodmlURL: ivoaLocation)

    instance(type: "stc2_measurements:domain.space.Position2D") {
        instance (role: "coord") {
            instance(role: "cmpt") {
                instance(role: "cval", value: 12.9768538031, unit: "deg")
                reference(role: "coordAxis") {
                    // This is not very portable or convenient. There should be a URI
                    remote "file://./standard-frames.vot#ICRS_RA_AXIS"
                }
            }
            instance(role: "cmpt") {
                instance(role: "cval", value: -72.9580158133, unit:"deg")
                reference(role: "coordAxis") {
                    remote "file://./standard-frames.vot#ICRS_DEC_AXIS"
                }
            }
        }
    }
}

def modelsFolder = "file:../models"

def measLocation = new URL("$modelsFolder/STC_meas-v2.0.vo-dml.xml")
def ivoaLocation = new URL("$voluteFolder/ivoa/vo-dml/IVOA-v1.0.vo-dml.xml")

dmInstance {
    model(vodmlURL: coordsLocation)
    model(vodmlURL: measLocation)
    model(vodmlURL: ivoaLocation)

    instance(type: "stc2_measurements:domain.space.Position2D") {
        instance (role: "coord") {
            instance(role: "cmpt") {

Time measurements

TT ISO Time

DSL

File: /examples/stc2/current/instances/tt-iso-time.jovial 

def modelsFolder = "file:../models"
def voluteFolder = "https://volute.g-vo.org/svn/trunk/projects/dm/vo-dml/models/"

def coordsLocation = new URL("$modelsFolder/STC_coords-v2.0.vo-dml.xml")
def measLocation = new URL("$modelsFolder/STC_meas-v2.0.vo-dml.xml")
def ivoaLocation = new URL("$voluteFolder/ivoa/vo-dml/IVOA-v1.0.vo-dml.xml")

dmInstance {
    model(vodmlURL: coordsLocation)
    model(vodmlURL: measLocation)
    model(vodmlURL: ivoaLocation)

    instance(type: "stc2_measurements:domain.time.TimeMeasure") {
        instance (role: "coord", type: "stc2_coordinates:domain.time.ISOtime") {
            instance(role: "cval", value: "2000-09-02T01:10:14") {
                reference(role: "coordAxis") {
                    // This is not very portable or convenient. There should be a URI
                    remote "file://./standard-frames.vot#TT_AXIS"
                }
            }
        }
    }
}

    model(vodmlURL: ivoaLocation)

    instance(type: "stc2_measurements:domain.time.TimeMeasure") {
        instance (role: "coord", type: "stc2_coordinates:domain.time.JD") {
            instance role: "cval", value: "2450814.52", unit: "d"
            reference(role: "coordAxis") {
                // This is not very portable or convenient. There should be a URI
                remote "file://./standard-frames.vot#JD_TT_AXIS"
            }
        }
    }
}

Custom Frames

The following example shows how to define a custom time frame in terms of standard ones.

TT MET Time

DSL

File: /examples/stc2/current/instances/tt-met-time.jovial 

def modelsFolder = "file:../models"
def voluteFolder = "https://volute.g-vo.org/svn/trunk/projects/dm/vo-dml/models/"

def coordsLocation = new URL("$modelsFolder/STC_coords-v2.0.vo-dml.xml")
def measLocation = new URL("$modelsFolder/STC_meas-v2.0.vo-dml.xml")
def ivoaLocation = new URL("$voluteFolder/ivoa/vo-dml/IVOA-v1.0.vo-dml.xml")

dmInstance {
    model(vodmlURL: coordsLocation)
    model(vodmlURL: measLocation)
    model(vodmlURL: ivoaLocation)

    instance(id: "MET_FRAME", type: "stc2_coordinates:domain.time.TimeFrame") {
        instance role: "timeScale", value: "TT"
        instance(role: "timeOrigin", type: "stc2_coordinates:domain.time.TimeOffset") {
            instance role: "cval", value: 50814.02
            reference(role: "coordAxis") {
                idref("file://./standard-frames.vot#MJD_TT_AXIS")
            }
        }

        instance(role: "coordSpace", type: "stc2_coordinates:domain.time.TimeSpace") {
            instance(role: "coordAxis", id: "_MET_TIME_AXIS") {
                instance role: "name", value: "time"
                instance role: "domainMin", value: 0
                instance role: "domainMax", value: "+Inf"
            }
        }
    }

    instance(type: "stc2_measurements:domain.time.TimeMeasure") {
        instance (role: "coord", type: "stc2_coordinates:domain.time.TimeOffset") {
            instance role: "cval", value: "84244214.7547", unit: "s"
            reference(role: "coordAxis") {
                // This is not very portable or convenient. There should be a URI
                idref "_MET_TIME_AXIS"
            }
        }
    }
}

Other Measurements

Magnitude with Symmetric Error

DSL

File: /examples/stc2/current/instances/magnitude-sym-error.jovial 

def modelsFolder = "file:../models"
def voluteFolder = "https://volute.g-vo.org/svn/trunk/projects/dm/vo-dml/models/"

def coordsLocation = new URL("$modelsFolder/STC_coords-v2.0.vo-dml.xml")
def measLocation = new URL("$modelsFolder/STC_meas-v2.0.vo-dml.xml")
def ivoaLocation = new URL("$voluteFolder/ivoa/vo-dml/IVOA-v1.0.vo-dml.xml")

dmInstance {
    model(vodmlURL: coordsLocation)
    model(vodmlURL: measLocation)
    model(vodmlURL: ivoaLocation)

    instance(type: "stc2_coordinates:domain.generic.GenericFrame") {
        instance(role: "coordSpace") {
            instance(role: "coordAxis", id: "MAG_AXIS") {
                instance role: "name", value: "mag"
            }
        }
    }

    instance(type: "stc2_measurements:domain.generic.GenericCoordMeasure") {
        instance(role: "coord") {
            instance role: "cval", value: "-0.28"
            reference(role: "coordAxis") {
                idref "MAG_AXIS"
            }
        }
        instance(role: "error", type: "stc2_measurements:uncertainty.Error1D") {
            instance(role: "statError", type: "stc2_measurements:stctypes.Symmetrical1D") {
                instance role: "radius", value: 9.85e-05
            }
        }
    }
}

Notes

At this point these are just my (olaurino) notes coming from implementing examples and thinking about applications.

Quantities

Some quantities are defined as ivoa:Quantity rather than a specific subtype. Was this intended?

Time type casting

Data producers need to explicitly cast the time-related types when serializing a time measurement. For instance, here is what you need to serialize an ISOTime (in DSL):


    instance(type: "stc2_measurements:CoordinateMDomains.timeMDomain.TimeMeasure") {
        instance (role: "coord") {
            instance(role: "cmpt", type: "stc2_coordinates:CoordinateDomains.timeDomain.ISOtime") {
                instance role: "cval", value: "2000-09-02T01:10:14"
                reference(role: "coordAxis") {
                    // This is not very portable or convenient. There should be a URI
                    remote "file://./standard-frames.vot#TT_AXIS"
                }
            }
        }
    }

versus JD:


    instance(type: "stc2_measurements:CoordinateMDomains.timeMDomain.TimeMeasure") {
        instance (role: "coord") {
            instance(role: "cmpt", type: "stc2_coordinates:CoordinateDomains.timeDomain.TimeOffset") {
                instance role: "cval", value: "2450814.52", unit: "d"
                reference(role: "coordAxis") {
                    // This is not very portable or convenient. There should be a URI
                    remote "file://./standard-frames.vot#JD_TT_AXIS"
                }
            }
        }
    }

Note that we need to explicitly cast the coordinate component to its actual type, i.e. CoordinateDomains.timeDomain.ISOtime or CoordinateDomains.timeDomain.TimeOffset.

I am not even sure my instances are correct, because the model has special JD and MJD types, so I should probably be using them.

So this is the first comment: the taxonomy might be too complex here for data producers and consumers to use.

How is this an advantage over a single datetime primitive object?

The one I can see is that some times are expressed as strings while others as numbers.

So one might have two types for times that are espressed as strings and times that are expressed as numbers.

It’s very possible that I am missing something, though.

Coordinate frames, positions, and axes.

Coordinate frames have a composition relationship with physical coordinate axes. However, as shown in the examples for icrs and fk4-b1950 it’s clear that the axes are the same and it might make sense to reuse them.

On the other hand, when you create a position, as in the examples, the position components don’t refer to the frame but to the axis, so the instances of the axes must be different.

So maybe this is fine: each individual frame defines its own instances of axes. There is some redundancy, but this way coordinates may refer to the axis rather than to the frame. On the other hand, it seems strange that positions do not refer to the frame if not through the constraint that axis instances can only belong to one parent frame.

A different approach might be to make the position refer to the frame and the individual components refer to the axes, removing all references from the frame to the axes. This way one could decouple the orientation and reference position of the reference frame from the definition of the axes. A position would need to reference a frame (position of the origin and orientation/epoch) and individual coordinate components would refer to the axis along which they are defined.

This would have several advantages:

  • only few axes (min value, max value, units, etc) could be defined and reused.
  • the number of reference frames in a standardized library would also be reduced, because it does not need to include all possible/common combinations of orientation, origin, and axes flavors.
  • it would make it easier for people to define custom reference frames: say all I need to change is an epoch, the number of types and attributes to implement is greatly reduced.
  • it would make it easier for clients to parse information in the presence of custom reference frames, as the axes would still be the same and part of a restricted number of possible instances (discounting extreme cases of customized coordinate systems), which would make it possible for the most common clients to make sense and good use of the data, even if they are unaware of details like orientation. In other terms, even an application that doesn’t know anything about astronomical reference frames should be able to represent data in spherical coordinates.

It’s very possible there might be disadvantages as well, however they would probably be shared with the current implementation, since all the above refactoring does is to decouple information that is not used when declaring positions anyway.

Other (minor) stuff

Some package names break the vodml conventions, e.g. CoordinateDomains.

A lot of names are redundant, for instance stc2_coordinates:CoordinateDomains might simply be stc2_coordinates:domains and CoordinateDomains.timeDomain be reduced to domains.time, thus turning stc2_coordinates:CoordinateDomains.timeDomain.TimeOffset to stc2_coordinates:domains.time.Offset.

Similarly, one can get rid of the obscure stc2_measurements:CoordinateMDomains.timeMDomain (note the extra ‘M’s) in favor of stc2_measurements:domains.time.

VODML Mapping

There is currently no mechanism for referencing an object by ID/URI. Should there be one or is REMOTEREFERENCE enough?
